Transcript: Livvie: Caleb?
Caleb: Here, my love.
Livvie: Why did you call me?
Caleb: Well, I wanted to see you. But not like this. Hey. You look sad.
Livvie: It’s Jack. He -- he’s left me. He’s gone.
Caleb: Gone?

Livvie: And I don’t know how it happened. I mean, I don’t remember how I
ended up in bed with a guy that I just met. Caleb, you have to tell me, did you
do this? Did you make Jack stop loving me?

Caleb: No, Olivia. I didn’t make him do anything. Sometimes life is like a
test, and it would seem that Jack has failed his.
Livvie: A test?

Caleb: That’s what I’ve been telling you all along. This boy’s love for
you is shallow and fleeting.

Livvie: He loved me completely. He promised forever. If I hadn’t messed up
--

Caleb: You made a mistake -- one mistake -- and he’s gone. How
"forever" is that? You're starting to see it now, aren’t you? Just
like all the others. What they thought is true love is, in reality, conditional
at best -- here today, gone tomorrow. But what we have is different, Olivia.
What we have is a love that will never die.
Eve: Ian --
Ian: Did I hear you right? You're leaving me?

Eve: I can’t be with a man who doubts me, a man who thinks I would
deliberately hurt my own child.
Kevin: He what?
Ian: Stay out of this, Kevin, please.
Kevin: I’m already in it.
Lucy: Doc, you got to stay out of this. This is between Eve and Ian.

Ian: Thank you. Speaking of doubting people -- you now think I’m some
kidnapper?
Eve: I can’t speak to you right now, Ian.

Kevin: And you know what, Eve? You don’t have to. You've come to me for
help. You have it. You can stay here as long as you need to.

Ian: Well, this is perfect, isn’t it? Just the way you planned. Here she
is, coming back to you, just running back to you.
Eve: I am not running to anyone.
Ian: Then what are you doing here?

Eve: Maybe I feel at home here. Maybe I feel safe. This was once my home
before --

Ian: Yeah, I know, I know. I forgot. Before the kidnapping that I set up to
set up -- break up your happy family. Hmm. Very good. Maybe -- maybe Kevin
doesn’t care about Lucy.
Kevin: All right, that’s enough. Get out!

Ian: Is that what this is about? You two wishing that things had turned out
differently?

Rafe: Anybody there? I asked you for help and I still haven’t heard from
you. It’s just -- it’s frustrating, you know? I mean, here I am, an angel
sent down here by you to do a job -- to protect Lucy and stop Caleb. Only
here’s the thing -- I can’t do this job because of all these -- forgive me,
but all these really lame rules I got to follow! Now, Caleb’s regaining his
power and I can’t do a thing to stop him. So you tell me -- what’s the point
here, huh? I mean, why didn’t you just send me down here blindfolded with my
hands tied behind my back? Hello? Is anybody listening? Can anybody hear me?
Well, if you can, hear this -- this job sucks!
[Thunder]

Man: Are you hearing me? I don’t really care if Sinatra is booked. I need a
real hard-ass for this assignment, and he’s it.
Rafe: It’s about time.
Man: What the hell do you want? I’m busy.

Rafe: I’ve been trying to reach you for days, sir. See, it’s about this
assignment.
Man: What about it?

Rafe: Truth be told, sir, I’m not really happy with it. See, it’s these
rules.

Man: Excuse me? You're not really happy? You asked for this assignment. You
begged me for it.
Rafe: I know, sir, but --

Man: You said you wanted to rid the world of this dirt bag who took your life
-- this vampire, remember?
Rafe: Caleb, yes.
Man: Said you'd do whatever it took, whatever it needed.
Rafe: Oh, that -- that’s true, sir, but --
Man: Yeah, that’s great. Then get back to work.
Rafe: I can’t do that.
Man: You can’t what?

Rafe: See, things have changed, sir. I can’t just guide Lucy anymore.
Caleb’s too powerful. She needs to be warned. They all do. They need to know
that he’s coming back!
Man: Forget it.
Rafe: With all due respect, sir --

Man: No, with all due respect, that’s not the way we work here. Yours is
only to steer. You do not drive.

Rafe: That’s just it. It’s all these pointless rules. And Caleb -- he has
none! I mean, what’s up with that?
Man: Sorry, kid. Deal with it.

Rafe: Fine. If you won’t help me, I’ll just do this on my own. I’ll do
whatever I think is necessary to protect these innocent lives. That means to
hell with the rules! Sir.

Eve: First you accuse me of harming my own son, and now you think I’m
plotting to get back with Kevin?
Ian: Is that any more ridiculous than what he’s whispering in your ear?
Kevin: Except that seems to be true.
Ian: The hell it is, Kevin.

Lucy: That is enough. Doc, you have got to listen to me. This is between
these two. You have to give them just some time to talk together.
Kevin: So you think what they need is to talk?

Lucy: Yes! At least give them a chance to talk. They cannot do that if you
keep sticking your nose into their business. Now, let’s go outside and give
them some room, please.
Kevin: No.
Eve: Kevin --
Lucy: Doc --
Eve: I can handle this.
Kevin: Are you sure?
Ian: What do you think; she’s in danger from her own husband?
Kevin: I do now, yes.
Eve: It’s ok. I’ll be fine, really. Please.
Kevin: I’ll be outside if you need me.  Lucy, what are you thinking?

Lucy: Do you want me to tell you what I’m thinking? Honestly, what I’m
really thinking?
Kevin: Mm-hmm.
Lucy: Ok, I’ll tell you. I’m thinking maybe Ian is absolutely right.
Kevin: What?
Lucy: Maybe you wanted Eve to leave him. You did, didn’t you?

Livvie: Maybe you're right. I needed to let go of Jack. He’s probably
better off without me.
Caleb: Maybe you're better off, too.
Livvie: I just feel so terrible for what I did to him.
Caleb: Someone who truly loves you doesn’t give up.
Livvie: Yeah, well, I betrayed him.

Caleb: You betrayed me, too. Did I walk away? Have I given up on you for even
one moment?
Livvie: No.
Caleb: You tried to kill me, and still I’m here, in love with you.
Livvie: You've never stopped.

Caleb: And I never will because what I feel for you is beyond boundaries.
It’s beyond anything you ever could experience with Jack. Think about it.
Think about a love that has no end and, no matter what happens, it’s there for
you forever.
Livvie: Forever.

Caleb: I know that sometimes that’s hard for you to comprehend. You've been
hurt so many times. People have disappointed you -- your mother, Jack.
Livvie: They all leave me.

Caleb: But I won’t. I will be there as long as you want me, as long as
you'll allow me to be. So, you see, the decision is yours, Olivia. You can be
alone in the cold, harsh world of these people, or you can have love, starting
right now, that will be everlasting.
Livvie: I don’t want to be alone. Caleb, I can’t be alone.
Caleb: You don’t have to be, my love. Not anymore.

Man: Ok, kid. You got it all figured out. You're going to make all these
changes. Tell me how you plan to break all the rules, huh?

Rafe: Well, first off, I’d just warn Lucy and all the others that Caleb’s
not dead -- or undead, or whatever. But, you know, I’d tell them that he’s
on his way back.
Man: Go on.

Rafe: And then I’d -- I’d find a way to trap him, you know, and just end
all this once and for all.
Man: You'd kill him?
Rafe: Yes. To protect these innocent people, yeah.
Man: I think maybe it’s revenge.
Rafe: What?

Man: Settling a score with this Caleb creep. That’s what’s driving you,
isn’t it, kid?
Rafe: No, I just --

Man: That’s why you called him out sooner than you should have and gummed
up the works.
Rafe: I never meant to do that.

Man: I don’t care what you meant. He knows what you are. You blew the hell
out of your own cover.
Rafe: No, I can still fix things! You see, if it wasn’t for these rules --
Rafe: No. It’s just that my friend -- these people are in so much pain.

Man: Well, that’s really tough, kid, because pain is part of life. People
grow stronger from pain. They learn from it. You got to let them make their own
decisions.
Rafe: Fine, but what if they make the wrong ones? What if Caleb wins?

Man: He might! He might. The battle between good and evil is as old as time.
Except we got something on our side -- our faith that the good in people’s
hearts will prevail. And therein lies your challenge, Rafe, my boy -- to remind
them of what’s inside, in here, that counts. You think you can do that, kid?
You think you can set aside your hatred for Caleb and help make that happen?
Huh?

Kevin: Do you think I wanted this to happen? Do you think I wanted Eve to
leave Ian and uproot their child like that?

Lucy: I don’t want to believe that, no. I do not want to believe that. But,
frankly, it’s getting harder and harder not to.

Kevin: You've asked me before if I have any feelings left for eve, and I told
you the answer is no.

Lucy: Well, maybe the two of you don’t even realize it. You know, who would
have thought she would have actually left Ian? But she did, and where does she
show up? She shows up at your door with her baby and all her bags, ready to move
right in.

Kevin: She’s scared, Lucy. She didn’t know where else to turn, and I am
still her friend.

Lucy: You're also still her ex-husband, and that is a fact I’m getting a
really hard time right now ignoring. I can’t.
Kevin: What are you talking about?

Lucy: You. Doc, don’t you see? You're obsessed with Ian’s past. And the
one point that keeps coming up in all that is that you and Eve were happily
married before the kidnapping.
Kevin: Actually, we weren’t.

Lucy: Well, whatever. Don’t you see? You're so possessed with her -- with
her life, her problems, everything -- that I’m beginning to feel like just
some sort of discarded consolation prize.
Kevin: You know that isn’t true.
Lucy: Do I really?

Kevin: Lucy, for the gazillionth time, I love you. We're engaged, for god’s
sake. I want to marry you. I want to spend the rest of my life with you.
Lucy: I -- I feel just a "but" coming here.

Kevin: The only "but" is that I still care about eve, but only as a
friend. And to be honest with you, if she needs to stay here, I won’t turn her
away.
[Daniel whimpers]

Ian: How’s it going? It’s all right. But it’s ok. It’s ok. There’s
my little boy. I know, it’s fine. It’s ok. It’s ok.
Eve: You really have a way with him.
Ian: Because I love him. And I love you.
[Daniel cries]
Ian: But it’s all right.
Eve: Shh.
Ian: And I know you're angry with me.
[Daniel cries]

Ian: Come here, it’s ok. Come here. I should never have questioned your
capabilities of being a mother. Sorry about that. But how can you believe
Kevin’s lies?
Eve: I have never known Kevin to lie.

Ian: He’s convinced the woman I love, without any evidence, to believe the
worst about me.
Eve: Why would he do that?

Ian: Because he hates me. He hates me for taking you away from him. But I can
live with that. What I can’t live with is you believing horrible things about
me.
Eve: I don’t know what to believe anymore.

Ian: Believe in us. Look at us. Believe in us. I love you, and I’ve loved
you from the moment I laid eyes on you. And I think you still care about me. So
let’s -- let’s not believe this stuff. Don’t believe I would ever hurt
you. You know I wouldn’t. We belong together. Look at us -- the three of us.
Let’s grab our stuff and go home as a family.
[Daniel whimpers]
Ian: I know it'll be all right.

Livvie: I still don’t understand how this is happening. I mean, you coming
back.
Caleb: When the time is right, you will understand everything.
Livvie: But when will that be?

Caleb: When I know I can trust you. And what you showed me today, that
isn’t far off. But for now all you need to know is that those people who tried
to destroy me are getting what’s coming to them. And when all this is said and
done, you and I are going to live happily ever after. You do want that, don’t
you? Happily ever after?
Livvie: It’s all I’ve ever wanted.
Caleb: Me, too. But there’s still work to be done.
Livvie: You're not going to hurt anyone?
Caleb: Hurt anyone? No, my love. Not I.
Ian: Come on, let’s go.
Eve: Yeah.
Kevin: Everything ok here?
Eve: Yes, I think it is.
Kevin: What’s going on?
Eve: Well, Ian and I talked, and --
Ian: And we're going home.
Kevin: Eve?
Eve: That’s right. I realize that I overreacted.
Kevin: Overreacted?
Ian: She’s made up her mind, Kevin.
Kevin: I wasn’t talking to you.
Eve: I have, Kevin, and I appreciate everything that you've done.

Kevin: Look, just do one thing. Just think about this for a while -- at least
a day.

Ian: She doesn’t have to think about it. She’s going home where she
belongs.
Eve: It’s all right, Kevin. I’ll call you if I need anything, ok?
Ian: Let’s go.
Eve: Thank you. Thanks.
Kevin: Where are you going?
Lucy: Eve isn’t the only one leaving. Good-bye, Doc.

Man: You just can’t deny that you've got your own reasons for wanting to
stop Caleb. I think I might have made a mistake. You're too green for this job.
Rafe: No. No, no, no, I can handle it!

Man: No, no, no, I’m sorry, son. You talked me into giving you this gig
against my better judgment, and it’s not going to happen again.
Rafe: So, what are you saying?
Man: I’m saying you're fired.
Rafe: Fired?
Man: Terminated, finished, done.
Rafe: No! No! No! No!
Man: Sorry, kid.
Rafe: You can’t do this!
Man: I’m doing it. You gave it your best shot. You're on your own.
Rafe: No, no, no. No, no, no. What about all those people down there?

Man: Well, until we can find somebody to take your place, they're on their
own.
Ian: Thanks for believing in me.

Eve: Well, you know, with everything that’s happened and us being on edge,
I --
Ian: It’s all right. You don’t have to explain.
Eve: I love you so much. That never changed.
Ian: I love you more than anything. Come on.  What’s wrong?

Eve: Ian, I just remembered something. Earlier, when I was here in the loft,
that window over there just blew right open and this cold gust of air came in,
and it blew little Danny’s picture off the windowsill. It shattered it to
pieces. And then, out of the blue, the mobile started playing on its own.
That’s why I freaked out. That’s why I went to Kevin’s house.

Ian: It’s ok. I’m -- I’m here now. I’ll check it out, all right?
Latch is broken, that’s all.
Eve: Ok, well, can you please fix it? It really needs to be fixed.
Ian: Well, I can’t fix it now. I’d have to go to the hardware store.
Eve: I don’t want that window to not be locked.
Ian: Ok. You going to be all right with me being gone?
Eve: Yes. Just hurry back, please.
Ian: Just as fast as I can.
[Eve gasps]
Eve: Who are you? What are you doing here?
Woman: I’m Anne-Marie.
Eve: No, you're not. Ian said Anne-Marie was dead.
Anne-Marie: I would have been if Ian had had his way.
Eve: What do you want?
Anne-Marie: I want to tell you what your loving husband did to me, eve.

>> Stay tuned for scenes from the next "Port Charles:
Tempted."
>> On the next "Port Charles" --

Frank: I’m not used to this wild side of you. It’s like you're on some
kind of drug.

Lucy: If people didn’t keep telling me I should know better, I would think
that Caleb sent some sort of curse down on us.
